intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis capensis, commonly known as the Cape pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to South Africa. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its sympodial growth habit. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and orchid enthusiasts.
